title: Establishes the actual innocence justice act 2011
summary: Establishes the actual innocence justice act of 2011; clarifies that convicted persons who can demonstrate a reasonable probability that they are innocent will have the right to challenge their convictions under the law, notwithstanding any other procedural or technical provisions of law that would have prevented them from doing so.
